question:
Forest fire is an increasing concern around the world. Which of the following are correct about forest fires in India?
  1. India has witnessed a 46% rise in forest fires since 2003.
  2. Maximum number of fires occur in Maharashtra.
  3. The NDRF which helps control fires, launched the Large Forest Fires Monitoring Programme.
  4. Pine trees are a major source of fires in Uttarakhand.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The forest fires have increased drastically in India- almost double the 2003 numbers. The 2015-17 period saw a staggering 125% spike in forest fires. Climate change and recurring heat-waves of high intensity are some of the main reasons. They are also man-made- sometimes initiated to cover the tracks of illegal timber smuggling. Statement 2 is incorrect: Most number of forest fires occur in Madhya Pradesh. In 2017, there were 4781 incidents in MP. Odisha and Chhattisgarh also account for a large percentage of India’s forest fires. 23 states in India have reported increase in forest fire incidence. In Punjab, the incidence increased by seven fold. Statement 3 is incorrect: Large Forest Fires Monitoring Programme was launched by the FSI/ Forest Survey of India in January, 2019. It is under the FAST/ FSI Fire Alert System. It gives real time data about forest fires. It will continuously assess the fire’s progress, identify areas for restoration work and also carry out damage assessment. Statement 4 is correct: Uttarakhand sees frequent fires, such as the 2016 incident. The fires have been blamed on the pine trees. These trees constitute 16% of the area and their resins are flammable. The state government is looking to generate electricity from the pine needles. The Pirul project will generate 675 KW of power when implemented.
